name: palmbegonia
description: Begonia luxurians is a terrestrial plant native to tropical regions of Brazil, particularly the Atlantic Forest. It belongs to the Begoniaceae family and features upright, cane-like stems (60-120 cm tall) with large, asymmetrical, dark green leaves with distinctive patterns. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit. Leaves often feature striking patterns including spirals, spots, stripes, and iridescent sheens, with some species having translucent "windows" in their leaves. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive foliage. It's popular among Begonia enthusiasts for its impressive size and attractive leaves.
careTips: Keep soil moist but not soggy
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
